AAPL Q2 2024 Earnings Summary (Reported May 2, 2024)

1. Revenue & Growth
‚Ä¢ Total Revenue: $90.8 billion (down 4% year-over-year).
‚Ä¢ iPhone Revenue: $46.0 billion (down 10% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Services Revenue: $23.9 billion (up 14% YoY, a new quarterly record).
‚Ä¢ Greater China Revenue: $16.4 billion (down 8% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Active Installed Base of Devices: Reached a new all-time high across all product categories.

2. Profitability
‚Ä¢ Gross Margin: 46.6% (up from 44.3% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Net Income: $23.6 billion (down 2% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Diluted EPS: $1.53 (flat YoY, but ahead of expectations).
‚Ä¢ Strong margin expansion driven by favorable mix shift toward higher-margin Services.

3. Guidance & Capital Returns
‚Ä¢ Did not provide formal quantitative guidance (standard practice since 2020).
‚Ä¢ Expects Q3 revenue to grow by a "low single-digit" percentage YoY.
‚Ä¢ Announced $110 billion share repurchase authorization (largest in U.S. history).
‚Ä¢ Increased quarterly dividend by 4% to $0.25 per share.

4. Key Metrics & Segments
‚Ä¢ Services Gross Margin: Continues to be a major profit driver, reported at 74.6%.
‚Ä¢ Wearables, Home & Accessories: Revenue of $7.9 billion (down 10% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Mac Revenue: $7.5 billion (up 4% YoY).
‚Ä¢ iPad Revenue: $5.6 billion (down 17% YoY).
‚Ä¢ Cash & Marketable Securities: $162.3 billion at quarter-end.

5. Risks & Opportunities
Risks:
‚Ä¢ Continued softness in iPhone sales, particularly in China amid competitive and macroeconomic pressures.
‚Ä¢ Potential for regulatory scrutiny (EU DMA, U.S. DOJ lawsuit) to impact Services growth and margins.
‚Ä¢ Foreign exchange headwinds and geopolitical uncertainties.
Opportunities:
‚Ä¢ Robust, high-margin Services growth fueled by a growing installed base.
‚Ä¢ Anticipated AI announcements at WWDC in June could drive a major upgrade cycle for iPhones and other hardware.
‚Ä¢ Massive capital return program provides strong shareholder support and signals confidence in long-term cash generation.
